instruction: How were the machine learning approaches utilized to analyze the FTIR spectra and predict treatment outcome in pediatric Ewing sarcoma patients?
Output:
Machine learning approaches were utilized to analyze the FTIR spectra and predict treatment outcome in pediatric Ewing sarcoma patients. Specifically, random forest and linear discriminant analysis supervised learning models were used to predict patient mortality. These models were trained on the FTIR spectra obtained from Ewing sarcoma tumors before and after neoadjuvant chemotherapy. The models achieved a 92% accuracy in predicting patient mortality using leave-one-out cross-validation.

Additionally, a linear Support Vector Machine (SVM) model was employed to predict patient relapse. This model was trained on the observed spectral changes as a result of chemotherapy treatment. The SVM model achieved a 92% accuracy in predicting patient relapse.

Overall, the machine learning approaches utilized the FTIR spectra data to develop predictive models for patient mortality and relapse in pediatric Ewing sarcoma patients.

instruction: Can Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy of tumour biopsy samples be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for predicting treatment outcome in paediatric Ewing sarcoma patients?
Output: Yes, Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy of tumour biopsy samples can be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for predicting treatment outcome in paediatric Ewing sarcoma patients. The past study found that FTIR spectra obtained from Ewing sarcoma tumours were able to predict patient mortality with 92% accuracy and patient relapse with 92% accuracy. This suggests that FTIR spectroscopy has a high predictive value and may provide more accurate and reliable information compared to traditional methods for predicting treatment outcome in paediatric Ewing sarcoma patients.
